summary: This research addresses the challenges faced by palliative care patients in transitioning to hospice care, specifically the delays in the admission process. The study investigates whether implementing a standardized workflow can enhance the rate of admissions from palliative care to hospice services. The results indicate a significant improvement, with an 11.5% increase in admissions and a 55.3% rise in the rate of electronic medical record chart deactivations after the intervention, demonstrating that the standardized workflow effectively facilitates smoother transitions for patients.
